<h2>Annotation</h2>
<dl>
 <dd>
  F –
  <a href="/wiki/Firearm" title="Firearm">
   Firearms
  </a>
  and other
  <a href="/wiki/Ranged_weapon" title="Ranged weapon">
   ranged weapons
  </a>
  , especially
  <a href="/wiki/Rifle" title="Rifle">
   rifles
  </a>
  and
  <a href="/wiki/Handgun" title="Handgun">
   handguns
  </a>
  , but also
  <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bow_(weapon)" title="Bow (weapon)">
   bows
  </a>
  and
  <a href="/wiki/Crossbow" title="Crossbow">
   crossbows
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Grenade_launcher" title="Grenade launcher">
   grenade launchers
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Flamethrower" title="Flamethrower">
   flamethrowers
  </a>
  , or
  <a href="/wiki/Slingshot" title="Slingshot">
   slingshots
  </a>
 </dd>
 <dd>
  M –
  <a href="/wiki/Melee_weapon" title="Melee weapon">
   Melee weapons
  </a>
  , like
  <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Knives" title="Knives">
   knives
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Sword" title="Sword">
   swords
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Spear" title="Spear">
   spears
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Machete" title="Machete">
   machetes
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Axe" title="Axe">
   axes
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Club_(weapon)" title="Club (weapon)">
   clubs
  </a>
  , rods,
  <a href="/wiki/Rock_(geology)" title="Rock (geology)">
   stones
  </a>
  , or bare
  <a href="/wiki/Hand" title="Hand">
   hands
  </a>
 </dd>
 <dd>
  O – Any other weapons, such as
  <a href="/wiki/Bomb" title="Bomb">
   bombs
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Hand_grenade" title="Hand grenade">
   hand grenades
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Molotov_cocktail" title="Molotov cocktail">
   Molotov cocktails
  </a>
  ,
  <a href="/wiki/Poison" title="Poison">
   poison
  </a>
  and
  <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Poisonous_gas" title="Poisonous gas">
   poisonous gas
  </a>
  , as well as
  <a href="/wiki/Vehicle" title="Vehicle">
   vehicle
  </a>
  and
  <a href="/wiki/Arson" title="Arson">
   arson
  </a>
  attacks
  <dl>
   <dd>
    A – indicates that an arson attack was the only other weapon used
   </dd>
   <dd>
    V – indicates that a vehicle was the only other weapon used
   </dd>
   <dd>
    E – indicates that explosives of any sort were the only other weapon used
   </dd>
   <dd>
    P – indicates that an anaesthetising or deadly substance of any kind was the only other weapon used (includes poisonous gas)
   </dd>
  </dl>
 </dd>
</dl>
